page.title: 13Law and Order in Bingley
page.content: Bingley has its own police station and Magistrates' Court. There are four cells at the station where people are detained for questioning or awaiting trial. 11 police officers drive the patrol cars and there are two dog handlers who work with trained dogs. The dogs are used mainly for tracking down criminals or for sniffing out drugs. The Magistrates' Court has two courtrooms, one used for adults and one for juveniles under sixteen. The court sits each day during the week. Usually three magistrates sit at each session and are advised on points of law by the Clerk to the Court. The crime rate in Bingley is about the same as the national average. The most common offence is theft.
